Creating an ETL object
The ETL object is the main entity of the ETL process with basic attributes and a schema
.
To create an ETL object, you need to:
1. Select from the navigation menu: Setting up ETL→ ETL processes registry.
2. Click
in the registry control panel to create an ETL object profile. The System will display an input form:
3. Enter the required data, where:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the name of the custom ETL object.
Identifier
Entering the object ID. It can be formed automatically.
Chart
Displaying the chart code when the ETL schema is ready; it is formed automatically.
Logging level
Choosing the logging level from the drop-down list. Possible values:
Information on stages: displaying errors (if any) and data on the progress;
Debug information: displaying errors (if any), data on the progress (including actions and results);
Full log: displaying the full log of the ETL process. Recommended when setting up a process;
Only errors: displaying errors (if any) in the ETL process.
Start object type
Defining the type of the start object. Specifying the object type
ETL. ETL object instance
, or its child type. For more information, refer to
Setting up ETL start
.
The full list of types in the parameter’s drop-down list becomes available after clicking the "Show all types" button
. This button is displayed if the user has the "Run" permission for
"View system types in the "Object type" registry"
.
Record the resulting data structures in the log
A boolean attribute that defines the recording of the resulting data structure in the log.
Parse get-request parameters into instance attributes
A boolean attribute that defines the ability of get-request parameters to get into the attributes of an instance of the object type generated.
Comment
Entering a user comment for the custom ETL object.
4. Save the ETL object profile using the
button. The System will display possible actions for the ETL object.
Setting
Purpose
Including a custom ETL in the service pack. For more information, refer to
Creating updates from the object profile
.
Creating/setting up an ETL schema. For more information, refer to
Setting up an ETL schema
.
Running a customized ETL process. For more information, refer to
Setting up ETL start
.
Implementing ETL cache invalidation.
Implementing a customized ETL process for the files specified.
